meanings.sent1: The weather forecast was inaccurate, as it said it would rain all day but it was sunny instead.
meanings.sent2: She gave an inaccurate answer to the math problem, getting the solution completely wrong.
meanings.sent3: It was inaccurate when he claimed to have seen a flying elephant in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an inaccurate compass, always leading her in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: The detective's inaccurate theory led to the wrong suspect being arrested.

meanings.sent1: The map was inaccurate, showing the wrong location for the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: His measurements were inaccurate, causing the furniture to not fit properly in the room.
meanings.sent3: It was inaccurate to say the cat was as big as a house; it was just a tiny kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her aim was like an inaccurate arrow, missing the target every time.
meanings.sent5: The clock's inaccurate time caused him to be late for the important meeting.
